SourceString:
Duration: <b>5s</> (independent)

Some abilities generate Overload stacks on use. The stacks can be <me_Cleanse>cleansed</>.
Take <b>1.5%</> Maximum Health per stack as combined <me_FireDam>Fire</> and <me_LightningDam>Lightning Damage</> per second.
<me_Cleanse>Cleanse</> <b>1</> stack for every <b>15</> Energy spent on Non-Fire/Non-Lightning skills.
Recover <b>5</> Energy per <me_Cleanse>cleansed</> stack over <b>1s</>.
DevComment:
No Maximum
Duration: <b>5s</> (independent)

Take <b>1%</> Maximum Health per stack as combined Fire and Lightning Damage per second.
Cleanse <b>1</> stack for every <b>15</> Energy spent on Non-Fire/Non-Lightning skills.

SourceString:
Maximum: <b>3</>
Duration: <b>8s</>

<b>Basic</> abilities generate <b>Overwhelm</> stacks on hit.
When at maximum, stacks can be consumed by <b>Overwhelm Abilities</> for stronger effects.
Maximum stacks: <b>3</>\r\nFull Overwhelm can be consumed to empower an ability.

Maximum: <b>10</>
Rage Stacks decay over <b>3s</> each. <b>20%</> more Decay Rate per stack.

<b>1%</> increased Total Attack Damage per stack
<b>1%</> increased Attack Speed per stack
Rage also grants:\n<b>1%</> increased Total Spell Damage per stack\n<b>1%</> increased Cast Speed per stack
While using an Exhaust skill you have <b>75%</> less Energy Regeneration.
DevComment:
While using an Exhaust skill you have Exhaust.

Causes <b>75%</> less Energy Regeneration.

SourceString: While above <b>50%</> Energy, <b>10%</> of Damage Taken is absorbed by Energy.
Target is struck by lightning.\nDeals Lightning Damage based on your Character Level.
Overflow occurs, whenever a status effect stack is gained while at maximum stacks of that status effect
Basic Abilities can be used with insufficient Energy as long as the Cost is not higher than <me_Reserve>Unreserved Energy</>.
A creature counts as channeling when it continously performs an ability.\r\nFor enemies this is signified with an icon above their head.
Stunned or Frozen and unable to act.

Some abilities generate Amplify stacks. \r\nThese count individually for each ability and do not overlap with other Amplify abilities.\r\nTheir effects and the method of gaining them are unique to the ability.
DevComment:
old: Amplify stacks are stored on abilities individually instead of on the character.
Effects and method of stacking are unique to the ability.

SourceString:
Maximum: <b>20</>
Duration: <b>3s</>

When Doom ends, the target takes <me_VitalityDam>Vitality Damage</> per stack.
DevComment: A status effect/debuff you can apply to enemies in various ways.

SourceString: Rupture deals <b>30%</> of target\'s Maximum Health as True Damage.\nMore powerful enemies take less Damage.\nCan only trigger once per target per <b>0.4s</>.

Maximum: <b>1</>
Duration: <b>2.5s</>

Some abilities or modifiers generate Flow.
Others can consume it for stronger effects.
DevComment:
Duration: <b>2.5s</>

Can be consumed by abilities for stronger effects.
You cannot benefit from the same modifier from multiple Blessings at the same time.

SourceString: Auras apply their effect to yourself and each <me_Ally>ally</> around you.\r\nYou cannot benefit from the same modifier from multiple Auras at the same time.
When you apply <me_Bleed>Bleed</>, you have a +<b>1%</> chance per <me_Bleed>Bleed</> stack on target to cause <me_Rupture>Rupture</>.
When you apply <me_Chill>Chill</>, you have a +<b>1%</> chance per <me_Chill>Chilled</> stack on target to <me_Freeze>Freeze</> for <b>1.5</>s.
Chance that a hit\'s damage is reduced by 50%.
Some abilities allow you to Mark a target.\nOther abilities can have effects on the Marked target.\nYou can only have one Mark active at the same time.

Ailments are applied as stacks and have various effects, depending on their type.\r\nMost deal Damage Over Time, some slow enemies or lower their <me_Resistance>Resistances</>.\r\nEach Ailment is applied by its coresponding damage type.
Inflicts damage equal to your Retaliation Damage to attackers near you.
Determines Energy Barrier cost.\r\n\r\nRate can be improved via gear and Masteries.
Adds its effect on cast, but <b>consumes Energy</> to do so.\n\nMainly increased via certain Armor types and Masteries.
Adds its effect on cast <b>without consuming</> Energy.\n\nMainly increased via Shields and Masteries.

Duration: <b>30s</> 

While you have an Infusion Skill equipped, using a Fire, Cold or Lightning Skill grants an Infusion of the same type. 
You can only have one infusion at a time. Generating a new one removes the current Infusion. 
Elemental Infusions can be consumed to empower Skills
Empower your next Infusion Skill with additional Fire Damage
Empower your next Infusion Skill with additional  <me_ColdDam>Cold Damage</>.
Empower your next Infusion Skill with additional Lightning Damage
Armor reduces physical damage based on type.\r\nFor example, Strike Armor reduces <me_StrikeDam>Strike Damage</>.
Resistance reduces the damage of the matching type.\r\nIt also helps to resist the application of the appropriate Ailment.

The chance an attack or spell has to apply an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nThe type of <me_Ailment>Ailment</> depends on the type of damage dealt and each hit can only apply one <me_Ailment>Ailment</> at the same time.\r\nWhen multiple damage types are dealt, the chance for an <me_Ailment>Ailment</> to be chosen depends on the amount of its according damage type.
DevComment: not super happy with this description yet, but adding it for now to iterate later.

SourceString: Damage is converted before any scaling is applied.\r\nWhen multiple conversions are active, their effects are split.\r\nFor example: When an attack has 100% Fire and 100% Cold conversion, it deals 50% of each.
Allies include summons, friendly NPCs and other players in multiplayer.
Stun counts as an <me_Impairment>Impairment</>.\r\nStunned creatures cannot act in any way for the duration of the stun.

Impairments interact with what actions a creature can perform and how.\r\nThe application of any Impairments is resisted with <me_Resistance>Impairment Resistance</>.\r\nExamples for Impairments include <me_Silence>Silence</>, <me_Slow>Slow</>, <me_Freeze>Freeze</> and <me_Stun>Stun</>.
Slow is an <me_Impairment>Impairment</>.\r\nA slowed creature has lower movement, attack and cast speed.
Silence is an <me_Impairment>Impairment</>.\r\nA silenced creature cannot cast spells and is prevented from using most abilities.
Freeze is an <me_Impairment>Impairment</>.\r\nA frozen creature is prevented from performing any actions.

Bleed is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Bleed deals high <me_DoT>Damage over Time</>.\r\nBleed is applied by <me_PierceDam>Pierce Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Pierce Resistance</>.

Chill is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Chill deals medium <me_DoT>Damage over Time</> and <me_Slow>slows</>.\r\nChill is applied by <me_ColdDam>Cold Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Cold Resistance</>.
Burn is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Burn deals high <me_DoT>Damage over Time</>.\r\nBurn is applied by <me_FireDam>Fire Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Fire Resistance</>.

Plagued is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Plagued deals high <me_DoT>Damage over Time</>.\r\nPlagued is applied by <me_PoisonDam>Poison Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Poison Resistance</>.

Shock is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Shock deals high <me_DoT>Damage over Time</>.\r\nShock is applied by <me_LightningDam>Lightning Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Lightning Resistance</>.
Weak is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Weak lowers <me_Resistance>Resistance</>.\r\nWeak is applied by <me_SpiritDam>Spirit Damage</> and resisted by <me_Resistance>Spirit Resistance</>.

Stagger is an <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nEach stack of Stagger <me_Slow>slows</>.\r\nStagger is applied by <me_StrikeDam>Strike</> and <me_VitalityDam>Vitality Damage</> and resisted by the matching <me_Resistance>Resistance</>.
Fire Damage is resisted by <me_Resistance>Fire Resistance</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Burn>Burn</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nFire Damage is increased by <me_Resolve>Resolve</>.
Pierce Damage is resisted by <me_Armor>Pierce Armor</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Bleed>Bleed</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nPierce Damage is increased by <me_Fitness>Fitness</>.
Strike Damage is resisted by <me_Armor>Strike Armor</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Stagger>Stagger</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nStrike Damage is increased by <me_Fitness>Fitness</>.
Cold Damage is resisted by <me_Resistance>Cold Resistance</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Chill>Chill</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nCold Damage is increased by <me_Resolve>Resolve</>.
Poison Damage is resisted by <me_Resistance>Poison Resistance</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Plague>Plague</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nPoison Damage is increased by <me_Cunning>Cunning</>.

Attributes are a character's mental and physical talents.
They determine their general capabilities and enable them to use different gear.
There are four Primary Attributes and they determine the power of the three Secondary Attributes.
Primary Attributes: <me_Agility>Agility</>, <me_Knowledge>Knowledge</>, <me_Might>Might</> and  <me_Vigor>Vigor</>
Secondary Attributes: <me_Cunning>Cunning</>, <me_Fitness>Fitness</> and <me_Resolve>Resolve</>.
Agility is a <me_Attribute>Primary Attribute</>.\r\nIt increases <me_Cunning>Cunning</> and <me_Fitness>Fitness</>.
Might is a <me_Attribute>Primary Attribute</>.\r\nIt increases <me_Fitness>Fitness</> and <me_Resolve>Resolve</>.
Knowledge is a <me_Attribute>Primary Attribute</>.\r\nIt increases <me_Cunning>Cunning</> and <me_Resolve>Resolve</>.

Vigor is a <me_Attribute>Primary Attribute</>.\r\nIt increases the character\'s Base Hitpoints. \r\nIt also increases all three Secondary Attributes (<me_Cunning>Cunning</>, <me_Fitness>Fitness</> and <me_Resolve>Resolve</>), but to a lower degree than the other <me_Attribute>Primary Attributes</>.

Cunning is a <me_Attribute>Secondary Attribute</>.\r\nIt scales <me_LightningDam>Lightning  Damage</> and <me_PoisonDam>Poison Damage</>.\r\nCunning gets increased by <me_Agility>Agility</> and <me_Knowledge>Knowledge</>.

Resolve is a <me_Attribute>Secondary Attribute</>.\r\nIt scales <me_FireDam>Fire Damage</> and <me_ColdDam>Cold Damage</>.\r\nResolve gets increased by <me_Might>Might</> and <me_Knowledge>Knowledge</>.

Fitness is a <me_Attribute>Secondary Attribute</>.\r\nIt scales <me_StrikeDam>Strike Damage</> and <me_PierceDam>Pierce Damage</>.\r\nFitness gets increased by <me_Agility>Agility</> and <me_Might>Might</>.

Lightning Damage is resisted by <me_Resistance>Lightning Resistance</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Shock>Shock</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nLightning Damage is increased by <me_Cunning>Cunning</>.
The two Physical damage types are <me_StrikeDam>Strike Damage</> and <me_PierceDam>Pierce Damage</>.
Vitality Damage is resisted by <me_Resistance>Vitality</>.\r\nIt has a chance to apply the <me_Stagger>Stagger</> <me_Ailment>Ailment</>.\r\nIt also has inherent 10%  <me_Lifesteal>Life Steal</>.
Energy Damage cannot be <me_Resistance>resisted</>.\r\nIt reduces a creatures current Energy on hit.

Some abilities or effects (usually constantly active ones like <me_Aura>Auras</>) reserve Energy.\r\nThe reserved Energy is removed from your maximum Energy Pool while the source of the reservation is active.\r\nYou cannot reserve more Energy than your maximum Energy.
While Unstoppable you are immune to crowd control effects like <me_Freeze>Freeze</> or <me_Stun>Stun</>.
Cleansing removes negative effects.\r\nThe amount and type of effects cleansed are usually described in the ability that caused the Cleanse.
Root is an <me_Impairment>Impairment</>.\r\nA rooted creature cannot move, but still use abilities.\r\nCertain Movement abilities break root, if they do it\'s described in their tooltip.

Damage Over Time effects tick in regular intervals to apply their damage over a specific timeframe.\r\nThe main example for DoT are <me_Ailment>Ailments</> like <me_Bleed>Bleed</> or <me_Burn>Burn</>.
Power is the strength of an <me_Ailment>Ailment</> effect.\r\nIt increases <me_DoT>Damage over Time</> as well as any other effect the <me_Ailment>Ailment</> has.

Each attack has a chance for a Critical Hit to occur.
Crits deal more damage and also have higher <me_AilmentChance>Ailment Chance</>.
The chance for this is defined by the following aspects:

• The attack’s Critical Hit <b>base chance</>.
• Weapon Attacks add the <b>weapon’s Critical Hit Chance</>.
• Any Critical Hit Chance modifiers from <b>gear or abilities</>.

If the Critical Hit Chance of an attack is <b>above 100%</> it can <me_SuperCrit>Supercrit</> .
Determines the amount of enemies a projectile can penetrate through when hitting before it disappears.
Determines the extra damage your <me_Critical>Critical Hits</> deal.
When hitting with a Lifesteal ability the user heals for the amount of Lifesteal the ability has.
Your Barrier decays to a certain threshold over time after being used.\r\nThe time it takes to decay depends on Barrier Decay Rate.\r\nThe amount it decays down to depends on Barrier Decay Threshold.
True Damage cannot be resisted by anything.\r\nIt does not apply any <me_Ailment>Ailments</>.\r\nIt is not increased by any <me_Attribute>Attributes</>.
Super Crits deal even more damage and also have higher <me_AilmentChance>Ailment Chance</> than normal <me_Critical>Critical Hits</>.

No Maximum
Duration: <b>5s</>

Take <b>1%</> Maximum Health per stack as combined Fire and Lightning Damage per second.
Cleanse <b>1</> stack for every <b>15</> Energy spent on Non-Fire/Non-Lightning skills.
DevComment: note: this will be moved to a different stringtable, this entry is for a temporary a hotfix on beta.

SourceString: Targets with Vulnerable take <b>20%</> increased Damage from all sources.\nCan be consumed from enemies to empower an ability.
Your Summons deal <b>30%</> more Damage\nYou deal <b>20%</> less Damage
<b>100%</> more Retaliation Damage\nYou and your Summons deal <b>20%</> less Damage with other sources
<b>2%</> increased Total Retaliation Damage per <me_Bulwark>Bulwark</> stack
<b>1%</> increased Damage per <me_Overload>Overload</> stack cleansed in the last <b>10s</>
Maximum: <b>10</>\r\nDuration: Infinite\r\nTake <b>1%</> less Damage per stack

Devices are <me_Summon>Summons</>.
They have an amount of <me_Activation>Activations</> when created.
Each time they activate, they consume an <me_Activation>Activation</>.
Enemies don't target Devices, but can destroy them with area-attacks.
Divine Cores are a resource used in the Forge Mastery.\r\nThey are dropped by enemies during combat.\r\nSome skills require Divine Cores as part of their cost.
Summons usually are creatures or Devices.\r\nTheir damage, speed and defenses are scaled via effects that specifically mention Summons.

Most <me_Device>Devices</> have Activations.\r\nEvery time a <me_Device>Device</> attacks or performs an action, it consumes one of these Activations.\r\nIf a <me_Device>Device</> is out of Activations, it gets destroyed.
Defines the amount of <me_Summon>Summons</> of the individual type you can have active at the same time.
Damage Penetration ignores a portion of the target\'s defenses of its type.
